value:
LOS ANGELES – On October 27-28, the Milken Institute will bring together CEOs, major investors, philanthropists and other leaders from around the world for its fourth annual London Summit. Like the Institute’s annual Global Conference – but on a more intimate scale – these leaders will focus on some of the world’s most pressing challenges. Panel topics include: whether central banks have created an asset bubble, the pace and challenges of Africa’s economic rise, and the current face-off between geoeconomics and geopolitics.“We are delighted to return to London, bringing with us the Milken Institute’s unique ability to convene leaders, and extend our work addressing the core issues of access to capital, improving health, and spurring job creation,” said Institute CEO and President Mike Klowden. “The range and complexity of the world’s challenges is unprecedented. At the Milken Institute London Summit, we expect our speakers and participants will generate ideas that lead to solutions.”Held at Salesforce Tower, the London Summit is an invitation-only event, but is open to registered media. Press may apply at http://www.cvent.com/events/milken-institute-london-summit-2014/event-summary-db02c71cca8a455aa20e2cbc6ebf0815.aspx and use code MEDIA-LS2014-MED.Speakers include:Madelyn Antoncic, Vice President and Treasurer, World BankShaukat Aziz, Former Prime Minister, Pakistan
B. Bonin Bough, Vice President, Global Media and Consumer Engagement, Mondelez International
Willem Buiter, CBE, Global Chief Economist, Citi
Eric Cantor, Vice Chairman and Managing Director, Moelis & Co.; Former Majority Leader, U.S. House of Representatives
Wesley Clark, Army General (ret.) and Former Supreme Allied Commander, NATO
Sir Richard Dearlove, Former Chief, British Secret Intelligence Service
Nigel Farage, Leader, UK Independence Party; Member, European Parliament
Adena Friedman, President, Global Corporate, Information & Technology Solutions, NASDAQ
Mo Ibrahim, Chairman, Mo Ibrahim Foundation
Wendy Kopp, CEO & Co-Founder, Teach for All; Founder & Chair, Teach for America
Michael Milken, Chairman, Milken Institute
Helena Morrissey, CEO, Newton Investment Management
Anne Richards, Chief Investment Officer and Executive Director, Aberdeen Asset Management PLC
Matt Ridley, Journalist and Author; Member, House of Lords
Alan Schwartz, Executive Chairman, Guggenheim Partners
Nirmala Sitharaman, Minister of State for Commerce and Industry and Minister of State for Finance and Corporate Affairs, India
Alexander Yakovenko, Russian Ambassador to the United Kingdom
Complete information about the Milken Institute London Summit, including a full program and a list of speakers confirmed to date, is available at http://www.milkeninstitute.org/events/conferences/summit/london-2014/
